contents.title: Rust crate for one shot web request handling
contents.desc: Build a crate for handling one-shot web requests for client side/ command line applications in Rust. Common use cases such as receiving token after authentication etc. can be handled using this crate in a synchronous manner. Deployed to crates.io

contents.title: AUTOR
contents.desc: Collaborator on a group project for CSC 540 at NCSU to demonstrate usage of database systems through a full scale task management system with the view of automotive mangement applications.

contents.title: GIT Quiz
contents.desc: Created and deployed a real-time web-based code judge used for assessment of tests taken by more than 100 students simultaneously. Supported languages include C, C++, Python and Java. Built using NodeJS, Redux and C++.

contents.title: Smart Spend
contents.desc: Collaborator on the group project to create a Telegram bot to track spending and send updates.

contents.title: Catch It!
contents.desc: Built a gesture-based arcade-game using OpenCV and PyGame. Player can control the cursor by movement of the object set to be tracked with image processing and pixel masking.

contents.title: This Website!
contents.desc: This website also started as one of my projects and is currently hosted as a static website on GitHub pages.

contents.title: Reddit Migrator
contents.desc: A quick Pyton script to transfer Reddit subscriptions & preferences from one account to another in an instant.

contents.title: Fork - XpensAuditor
contents.desc: Contributor to the fork of the project XpensAuditor which is an Android app that uses Google Firebase and MailJet APIs to manage and share expenses. Fun Fact: Experimented with GitHub organization and project management tools to create an organization for our team which was the first to use such mechanism in the class.

contents.title: WebRTC FileShare
contents.desc: This project uses the WebRTC protocol to establish a peer-to-peer connection and provide a quick utility for sharing files between offline devices which can communicate with each other (i.e., the devices are network reachable).

contents.title: Tic-Tac-Toe Bot
contents.desc: Tic-Tac-Toe bot which learns using Machine Learning to play better after every game. Works by reloading previous learnt values to avoid building the model from scratch. Uses SGD Classifier of scikit-learn for partial fitting. Accuracy increases over experience ( default learning rate maintained )

contents.title: OrganizEd Android App Fork
contents.desc: This project was created as a part of the WISE program. This is the completely changed version of the initial app OrganizEd which helps students organise their schedule and share notes among each other.

contents.title: Sticky Note Extractor
contents.desc: A Python CL-Script for fetching contents of Sticky Notes in Windows 10 and sending them to personal or note-taking email.

contents.title: Space Hunter
contents.desc: A hackathon attempt to remake the original title 'Galaxian' as a browser based game

contents.title: Wiki Speaker
contents.desc: Gives voice output of entered seach query by getting information from Wikipedia.

contents.title: Web mp3 Download Util
contents.desc: A simple python script to download mp3 files (written before yt-dl added this functionality.)
